chainsaw.lazy.lazysaw — Lazily Evaluated Chainsaw¶

class chainsaw.lazy.lazysaw(*things, **kw)[source]¶

lazy chainsaw

all()¶

Tell if everthing in a series of things is True.

any()¶

Tell if anything in a series of things is True

append(thing)¶

Insert thing after any other incoming things.

appendstart(thing)¶

Insert thing before any other incoming things.

arguments(*args, **kw)¶

Assign any positional and/or keyword arguments to be used anytime the current callable or alternative callable is invoked.

as_ascii(errors='strict')¶

Set wrapper to encode each incoming things as a byte encoded with the 'ascii' codec (regardless of its original type)

Parameters:errors – error handling for decoding issues (default: 'strict')
classmethod as_auto()¶

Switch to context where incoming things are automatically rebalanced with outgoing things.

as_bytes(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

Set wrapper to encode each incoming thing as a byte (regardless of its original type).

Parameters:
  • encoding – Unicode encoding (default: 'utf-8')
  • errors – error handling for encoding issues (default: 'strict')
as_deque()¶

Set wrapper to deque.

as_dict()¶

Set wrapper to dict.

as_edit()¶

Switch to editing context where operations can be performed on incoming things from initial placement to final extraction.

as_frozenset()¶

Set iterable wrapper to frozenset.

as_frozenstuf()¶

Set wrapper to frozenstuf.

as_list()¶

Set wrapper to list.

classmethod as_manual()¶

Switch to context where incoming things must be manually rebalanced with outgoing things.

as_many()¶

Switch to performing operations on each incoming thing as just one individual thing in a series of many individual things.

as_one()¶

Switch to performing operations on incoming things as one whole thing.

as_ordereddict()¶

Set wrapper to OrderedDict.

as_orderedstuf()¶

Set iterable wrapper to orderedstuf.

as_set()¶

Set iterable wrapper to set.

as_stuf()¶

Set iterable wrapper to stuf.

as_truth()¶

Switch to evaluation context where the results of operations on incoming things determine which of two potential paths to execute. After exiting the evaluation context by invoking which, incoming things automatically revert to a prior baseline snapshot of incoming things so further operations can be performed on an unmodified baseline version.

as_tuple()¶

Set wrapper to tuple.

as_unicode(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

Set wrapper to decode each incoming thing as unicode (str` under Python 3) (regardless its original type).

Parameters:
  • encoding – Unicode encoding (default: 'utf-8')
  • errors – error handling for decoding issues (default: 'strict')
as_view()¶

Switch to query context where the results of operations on incoming things queried. Upon exit from query context by invoking results or end, incoming things automatically revert to a prior baseline snapshot of so that further operations can be performed on an unmodified baseline version.

at(n, default=None)¶

Return thing at n index within an iterable or default if nothing is found at n index.

Parameters:
  • n – index of some thing
  • default – default thing (default:: None)
average()¶

Average value within a series of things.

balanced¶

Determine if incoming and outgoing things are in balance

choice()¶

Select a random choice from a series of things.

clear()¶

Clear out everything.

clear_in()¶

Clear incoming things.

clear_out()¶

Clear outgoing things.

combinations(n)¶

Each possible combinations for every number of things within a series of things.

Parameters:n – number of things to derive combinations from
concat()¶

Merge many iterables into one iterables.

copy()¶

Duplicate each thing in a series of things

count()¶

Number of incoming things.

count_out()¶

Number of outgoing things.

difference(symmetric=False)¶

The difference between a series of things.

Parameters:symmetric – use symmetric difference (default: False)
disjointed()¶

The disjoint between a series of things.

end()¶

Return outgoing things, cleaning out everything afterwards.

extend(things)¶

Insert things after any other incoming things.

extendstart(things)¶

Insert things before any other incoming things.

filter(pattern=None, invert=False, flags=0)¶

Things within a series of things that pass a filter. By default things that evaluate to True pass the filter but if the reverse flag is set to True than things that evaluate to False pass the filter while things that evaluate to False do not. If a pattern is supplied the filter will be a regular expression. Otherwise the current callable is used.

Parameters:
  • pattern – regular expression search pattern (default: None)
  • invert – return things for which filter is False rather than True (default: False)
  • flags – regular expression flags (default: 0)
find(pattern=None, invert=False, flags=0)¶

The first in a series of things that pass a filter. By default things that evaluate to True pass the filter but if the reverse flag is set to True than things that evaluate to False pass the filter while things that evaluate to False do not. If a pattern is supplied the filter will be a regular expression. Otherwise the current callable will be used.

Parameters:
  • pattern – regular expression search pattern (default: None)
  • invert – return things for which filter is False and not True (default: False)
  • flags – regular expression flags (default: 0)
first(n=0)¶

Return either n things from the start of an iterable or just the first thing in the iterable.

Parameters:n – number of things (default:: 0)
flatten()¶

Reduce an iterable of nested things to an iterable of unnested things.

frequency()¶

Count of each thing within a series of things.

groupby()¶

Group things together using the current callable as the key function.

initial()¶

Return everything in an iterable except the very last thing.

intersection()¶

The intersection between a series of things.

invoke(name)¶

Invoke method name on each thing within a series of things with the current positio nnd keyword arguments but return the thing as the result if the method returns None.

Parameters:name – method name
items(*keys)¶

Collect object items from a series of things matching their keys.

join(separator=u'', encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

Combine an iterable into one unicode (str on Python 3) regardless of type.

Parameters:
  • separator – string to join at (default:: '')
  • encoding – Unicode encoding for things (default:: 'utf-8')
  • errors – error handling when encoding things (default:: 'strict')
last(n=0)¶

Return either n things from the end of an iterable or just the last thing.

Parameters:n – number of things (default:: 0)
map(args=False, kwargs=False, current=False)¶

Invoke current callable on each thing in an iterable. Pass results of iterable as *args to current callable if args flag is set. Pass results of iterable to current callable as a tuple of *args and **kwargs if kwargs flag is set.

Parameters:
  • args – map each thing as a tuple of Python *args for the current callable (default: False)
  • kwargs – map each thing as a tuple of Python *args and **kwargs for the current callable (default: False)
  • current – map each thing as a :class”tuple of Python *args and **kwargs and any assigned positional and/or keyword arguments for the current callable (default: False)
mapping(keys=False, values=False)¶

Collect keys and values from a series of mappings.

Parameters:
  • keys – gather keys only (default: False)
  • values – gather values only (default: False)
max()¶

Maximum value within a series of things using current callable as the key function.

median()¶

Median value within a series of things.

min()¶

Minimum value within a series of things using the current callable as the key function.

minmax()¶

Minimum and maximum values within a series of things.

partition(pattern=None, flags=0)¶

Lump a series of things into True and False things based on the results of the current callable.

Parameters:
  • pattern – regular expression search pattern (default: None)
  • flags – regular expression flags (default: 0)
permutations(n)¶

Each possible permutation for every number of things within a series of things.

Parameters:n – number of things to derive permutations from
preview()¶

Take a peek at the current state of outgoing things.

product(n=1)¶

Results of nested for each loops repeated a certain number of times.

Parameters:n – number of loops to repeat (default: 1)
quantify()¶

Number of how many times current callable evaluates to True within a series of things.

range()¶

Statistical range within a series of things.

reduce(initial=None, reverse=False)¶

Reduce an iterable down to one thing using the current callable. If reverse is set to True, reduction comes from the right side of the iterable. Otherwise, reduction comes from the left side of the iterable.

Parameters:
  • initial – starting value (default:: None)
  • reverse – reduce from right side of iterable (default:: False)
repeat(n=None, call=False)¶

Repeat a series of things or the results of the current callable.

Parameters:
  • n – number of times to repeat (default: None)
  • call – repeat result of current callable (default: False)
replace(pattern, new, count=0, flags=0)¶

Replace segments within a series of strings with a new string segment if they match a pattern.

Parameters:
  • pattern – regular expression search pattern
  • new – replacement string
  • count – number of replacements to make in a string (default: 0)
  • flags – regular expression flags (default: 0)
rest()¶

Return everything in an iterable except the very first thing.

results()¶

Return outgoing things, clearing outgoing things afterwards.

reverse()¶

Reverse the order of a series of things.

sample(n)¶

Take a random sample drawn from a series of things.

Parameters:n – sample size
shift_in()¶

Manually copy outgoing things back to incoming things.

shift_out()¶

Manually copy incoming things to outgoing things.

shuffle()¶

Randomly reorder a series of things.

slice(start, stop=False, step=False)¶

Slice an iterable down to a certain size.

Parameters:
  • start – starting index of slice
  • stop – stopping index of slice (default: False)
  • step – size of step in slice (default: False)
snapshot(baseline=False, original=False)¶

Take a snapshot of current incoming things.

Parameters:
  • baseline – make this snapshot the baseline snapshot (default: False)
  • original – make this snapshot the original snapshot (default: False)
sort()¶

Sort a series of things using the current callable as the key function.

split(n, fill=None)¶

Split an iterable into multiple iterables of length n while using fill value to pad out any incomplete iterables.

Parameters:
  • n – number of things per split (default: 0)
  • fill – value to pad out incomplete iterables with (default: None)
subset()¶

Tell if a series of things is a subset of other series of things.

sum(start=0, floats=False)¶

Add the value of a series of things together.

Parameters:
  • start – starting number (default: 0)
  • floats – incoming are floats (default: False)
superset()¶

Tell if a series of things is a superset of another series of things.

tap(call, alt=None, factory=False)¶

Assign current callable. Optionally assign an alternative callable. If factory flag is set to True, use the callable passed with the call argument as a factory to build the current callable.

Parameters:
  • call – callable assigned as current callable
  • alt – callable assigned as alternative callable (default: None)
  • factory – whether call is a factory that produces callables (default: False)
undo(snapshot=0, baseline=False, original=False)¶

Revert incoming things to a previous snapshot of incoming things.

Parameters:
  • snapshot – number of steps ago e.g. 1, 2, 3, etc. (default: 0)
  • baseline – revert incoming things to baseline snapshot ( default: False)
  • original – revert incoming things to original snapshot ( default: False)
union()¶

The union between two series of things.

unique()¶

Get unique things within a series of things while preserving order and remember everything ever encountered.

untap()¶

Clear any current callable, alternative callable, or assigned position or keywork arguments.

unwrap()¶

Set wrapper to list.

weave()¶

Interleave multiple iterables into one iterable.

which(call=None, alt=None)¶

Choose current callable based on results of condition mode.

Parameters:
  • call – new callable to use if condition is True (default: None)
  • alt – new external callable to use if condition is False (default: None)
wrap(wrapper)¶

Iterable wrapper for outgoing things.

Parameters:wrapper – an iterable wrapper
zip()¶
